titleInfo.title: Oral history interview with Mildred Owsley Buchanan, 1980 November, excerpt 01

physicalDescription.note: Excerpted from: CentIIIBuchanan audio cassette recording converted to mp3 format in 2006.

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville educator Mildred Owsley Buchanan., conducted on two dates in November 1980 by Paul Clements as part of the Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project. Buchanan, a home economics teacher in Nashville city schools from the late 1920s through ca. 1963, discusses the Buttermilk Ridge area of Nashville on Lebanon Road where she grew up. This area was home to several dairies, which is how the area got its name. The complete interview is available in the repository.

titleInfo.title: Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project
